results.content: This course is a direct copy of a tutorial readily available on the internet and offers little explanation throughout. The author does not provide code samples or any access to working versions of the code he describes, but rather points you to a Discord server to which he selectively answers questions. After taking a similar course by Stephen Grider, I expected much more detail and description. I will be asking Udemy for a refund, and will strongly reconsider taking further classes with them.

response.content: This is not true. This is a personal project that I wanted to make a course. The code is available in the first slides of the course and you can always ask questions here and in Discord. I am a full-time employee with personal affairs as well and don't have time to answer all questions, it's not that I selectively answer questions here or on Discord.

results.content: Like other students said, the instructor didn't explained well enough of why the code has to be this way. Overall is a very good course if the student already knowledge of React and just want to learn how to create the project from the ground-up.

results.content: Super interesting course. I Liked the fast pace and quick explanations.

results.content: This was a good course but I think there is a lot of room for improvement. In terms of course content, I think David could have spent more time explaining how redux toolkit works and spent more time on testing parts of the ui. We really only tested the reducers. I would also like there to be some explanation on the docker file and docker compose. In terms of user experience, David is not running his editor zoomed in at all so it is really hard to see what he is typing and he has some linting features turned on that make it even harder to see what he is doing. He is also using a plugin or something for auto imports and if you don’t have it then you will need to pause quite often to manually import everything. I think the course project was cool but it does not feel complete.

results.content: Good best practices and code to learn from.  Explanation of concepts light in some areas.

results.content:
You will build a cool code editor but have absolutely no idea what you wrote or why you did it. Very little explanation for the code that's written. Also, there is a folder for every little thing and the instructor switches back and forth so quick it's hard to follow along without stopping the video to figure out where he is at. 

Pros: Instructor does respond to comments 
quickly.

Cons: You won't learn very much but will have a cool app after.
